audit.description:
REDCap Audit Log Shipper settings
            See original documentation @ https://github.com/bitnami/charts/tree/main/bitnami/logstash

enableMultiplePipelines.description: If set to `true`, allows the use of multiple pipelines. Needed for audit concurrent pipelines for performance reasons.
enableMultiplePipelines.title: enableMultiplePipelines

enabled.description: If set to `true`, enables the audit log-shipping solution.
enabled.title: enabled

existingConfiguration.description: Name of an existing ConfigMap holding the pipeline(s)'s configuration.
existingConfiguration.title: existingConfiguration

extraVolumeMounts.description: Volume mounts required for Logstash's deployment.
extraVolumeMounts.title: extraVolumeMounts

command.description: Command to be run to download and extract the JDBC driver.
command.title: command

value.description: URL of the JDBC driver to download.
value.title: value

image.description: Image used for the pod downloading the driver.
image.title: image

imagePullPolicy.description: Image pullPolicy used for the pod downloading the driver.
imagePullPolicy.title: imagePullPolicy

volumeMounts.description: Volume mount used to persist the JDBC driver.

mountPath.description: Mount path ofthe volume used to persist the JDBC driver.
mountPath.title: mountPath

volumeMounts.title: volumeMounts

logsApi.description: Configuration of the endpoint of the audit stack the logs are send to.

caPath.description: Path to the certificate used to validate the audit stack endpoint's certificate.
caPath.title: caPath

pollingSchedule.description: Scheduling of the rate at which Logstash will query REDCap database for nez event. Must be in `cron` format.
pollingSchedule.title: pollingSchedule

logsApi.title: logsApi

accessModes.description: Access Mode used for Logstash's persistence.
accessModes.title: accessModes

enabled.description: If set to `true`, enables persistence for Logstash. Useful for disaster recovery purposes, as the pipeline(s)'s cache is stored persisted by Logstash.
enabled.title: enabled

storageClass.description: Storage class used for Logstash's persistence.
storageClass.title: storageClass

app.kubernetes.io/role.description: Role to set for the networkPolicies. Not to be changed, unless you know exactly what you are doing!
app.kubernetes.io/role.title: app.kubernetes.io/role

audit.title: audit

accessKeyID.title: accessKeyID

existingSecret.description:
Reference to an existing secret holding the AccessKeyID and SecretAccessKey needed for authentication on the S3 bucket.
   If set, overrides the AccessKeyID and SecretAccessKey values.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

secretAccessKey.description: SecretAccessKey needed for authentication on the S3 bucket.
secretAccessKey.title: secretAccessKey

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

affinity.description: Affinity for the the Apache HTTPD pod(s).
affinity.title: affinity

enabled.description: If `true`, activates the deploment of the Apache HTTPd proxy.
enabled.title: enabled

nodeSelector.description: Node Selector for the the Apache HTTPD pod(s).
nodeSelector.title: nodeSelector

replicaCount.description: Number of replicas wanted for the Apache
replicaCount.title: replicaCount

resources.description: Resources for the Apache HTTPd pod(s).
resources.title: resources

enabled.description: If `true`, activates the Shibboleth daemon, which enables is needed for enabling SAMLv2 authentication with REDCap.
enabled.title: enabled

entityID.description: EntityID of the SAMLv2 Identity Provider (IdP).
entityID.title: entityID

key.description: Key of the secret holding the metadata file for the Identity Provider.

name.description: Name of the secret holding the metadata file for the Identity Provider.
name.title: name

entityID.description: EntityID of the SAMLv2 Service Provider (SP).
entityID.title: entityID

existingSecret.description: Reference to the secret holding the metadata file for the Service Provider.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

caChain.description: Configuration relating to the certification chain certificate.

secretKeyRef.description: Reference of an existing Secret holding the certificate for the certification chain, if needed.

name.description: The name of the existing Secret holding the certificate for the certification chain, if needed.
name.title: name

certificate.description: Configuration relating to the server TLS certificate.

enabled.title: enabled

tolerations.description: Toleration for the the Apache HTTPD pod(s).

mysql.description:
REDCap MySQL Database settings
            See original documentation @ https://github.com/bitnami/charts/tree/main/bitnami/mysql

architecture.description: Deployment type for the database, standalone or replicated.
architecture.title: architecture

createDatabase.description: Automatically create a database at the first run.
createDatabase.title: createDatabase

database.description: Name of the database automatically created at the first run, if ``mysql.auth.createDatabase` has been set to `true`
database.title: database

password.description:
Name of the database user automatically created at the first run, if ``mysql.auth.createDatabase` has been set to `true`
   Not secure in production, use secret reference instead!
password.title: password

username.description: Name of the database user automatically created at the first run, if ``mysql.auth.createDatabase` has been set to `true`
username.title: username

enabled.description: If set to `true`, enables the deployment of MySQL as REDCap's database.
enabled.title: enabled

fullnameOverride.description:
Override og the full name of the MySQL Database deployment.
   Impacts the name of the services REDCap will use to connect to the Database.
fullnameOverride.title: fullnameOverride

initdbScriptsConfigMap.description: Name of a configmap holding an SQL script to initialize the database with.
initdbScriptsConfigMap.title: initdbScriptsConfigMap

existingConfigmap.description: Name of existing ConfigMap with MySQL Primary configuration.
existingConfigmap.title: existingConfigmap

size.description: Size of the storage used for database persistence.
size.title: size

app.kubernetes.io/role.description: Role to set for the networkPolicies. Not to be changed, unless you know exactly what you are doing!
app.kubernetes.io/role.title: app.kubernetes.io/role

mysql.description: Port exposed by the MySQL service.
mysql.title: mysql
mysql

enabled.description: If set to `true`, enables NetworkPolicies. Highly recommended for production!
enabled.title: enabled

accessMode.description: AccessMode of the volume used to persist documents uploaded by REDCap users.
accessMode.title: accessMode

name.description:
Name of an existing PVC used to persist documents uploaded by REDCap users.
   If set, overrides the previous settings, as no PVC will be created for that purpose.
name.title: name

size.description: Size of the volume used to persist documents uploaded by REDCap users.
size.title: size

storageClass.description: StorageClass of the volume used to persist documents uploaded by REDCap users.
storageClass.title: storageClass

accessMode.description: AccessMode of the volume used to persist REDCap code.
accessMode.title: accessMode

name.description:
Name of an existing PVC used to persist REDCap code.
   If set, overrides the previous settings, as no PVC will be created for that purpose.
name.title: name

size.description: Size of the volume used to persist REDCap code.
size.title: size

storageClass.description: Storage Class of the volume used to persist REDCap code.
storageClass.title: storageClass

imagePullSecrets.description: ImagePullSecret of the Admin Job's image.
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

pullPolicy.description: PullPolicy of the Admin Job's image.
pullPolicy.title: pullPolicy

repository.description: Image of the Admin Job. Must be and FCGI Client capable to query REDCap's pod(s).
repository.title: repository

tag.description: Tag of the Admin Job's image.
tag.title: tag

resources.description: Resources for the admin job's pod.
resources.title: resources

schedule.description: Schedule of the Admin Job, which runs every minute by default. This job is needed to refresh REDCap administrative's data.
schedule.title: schedule

adminMail.description: The email of the administrator that is presented to the users.
adminMail.title: adminMail

hostname.description: The hostname of REDCap's database instance.
hostname.title: hostname

key.description:
The key of the secret holding the password used to connect to REDCAP's database.
   If set, the value of that secret will override the `redcap.config.database.auth.password.value` value.
key.title: key

name.description:
The name of the secret holding the password used to connect to REDCAP's database.
   If set, the value of that secret will override the `redcap.config.database.auth.password.value` value.
name.title: name

value.description: The password used to connect to REDCAP's database.
value.title: value

username.description: The username used to connect to REDCAP's database.
username.title: username

key.description:
The key of the secret holding the value of the salt used by the application to cypher sensitive data.
   If set, the value of that secret will override the `redcap.config.database.salt.value` value.
key.title: key

name.description:
The name of the secret holding the value of the salt used by the application to cypher sensitive data.
   If set, the value of that secret will override the `redcap.config.database.salt.value` value.
name.title: name

value.description: The value of the salt used by the application to cypher sensitive data.
value.title: value

externalURL.description: The URL on which the application is exposed (useful if the application is behind a reverse-proy).
externalURL.title: externalURL

logAllErrors.description: If set to `true`, will log all the errors on the stdout (NOT RECOMMENDED IN PRODUCTION).
logAllErrors.title: logAllErrors

from.description: The sender name that will display on mails send by REDCap.
from.title: from

existingSecret.description:
Reference to an existing secret holding the password used to connect to the mail server.
   If set, the value of that secret will override the `redcap.config.mail.auth.password.value` value.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

value.description: The password used to connect to the mail server.
value.title: value

port.description: The port of the mail server used by REDCap.
port.title: port

server.description: The hostname or IP of the mail server used by REDCap.
server.title: server

starttls.description: If `true`, will use StartTLS for the connection to the mail server.
starttls.title: starttls

tls.description: If set to `true`, will secure the communication with the mail server with TLS.
tls.title: tls

username.description: The username used to connect to the mail server.
username.title: username

readOnlyAppDir.description:
Prevents modifications on REDCap application directory for security reasons. Not compatible with the 
   `Easy Upgrade` feature, that shoud be disabled from the Control Center if this option is enabled.
readOnlyAppDir.title: readOnlyAppDir

key.description:
The key of the secret containing the CA Certificate ued by the curl library of the application to reach external services, like an OIDC provider.
   Useful some of those services are not signed by known CAs.
key.title: key

name.description:
The name of the secret containing the CA Certificate ued by the curl library of the application to reach external services, like an OIDC provider.
   Useful some of those services are not signed by known CAs.
name.title: name
